oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mississippi I
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mississippi River; Mississippi River Commission; steamboats; U.S. Army Corps of Engineers;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Mississippi I, an inspection vessel for the Mississippi River Commission and a towboat for the Army Corps of Engineers. This hand-colored photograph was taken near New Madrid, Missouri, in 1954 or 1955. The photographer, Paul McKinney, also built the model of the steamer which resides at the Tunica RiverPark museum.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: McKinney, Paul
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Gift of George R. "Jack" Jones, Jr.
